text: Duolingo is a free language-learning program. Its website and mobile apps can be used on iOS, Android, Windows 8 and 10 operating systems. Duolingo allows people to learn over 106 different language courses in 43 languages. ==History== The project was started by Professor Luis von Ahn and graduate student Severin Hacker. The main development language used was Python. == Products and services == === Courses === ==== Language courses ==== Duolingo has 184 language courses teaching 42 languages. French, German, Italian, Russian, Spanish Ukrainian English, French, German, Italian, Spanish Vietnamese Chinese (Mandarin), English, French, German, Italian, Spanish ==Offices and workforce== Duolingo is headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, and has offices in Seattle, New York, Detroit, Beijing, and Berlin. Duolingo employs around 830 people. == References == ==Other websites== * Category:American websites Category:Learning
